page.title: 12DINDER
page.content: The pretty estate village of{Dinder lies in the{Sheppey Valley}around the two great houses:{Dinder House}(home of the{Somerville}family ) and {Sharcombe Park.}Both houses are early 19th century. The cottages are of Dolomitic Conglomerate but are very varied in style. The church is 15th century and its lych gate is dedicated to one of the Somerville's. The great charm of Dinder is the{leat which runs along the side of the road in front ofthe old school and school house. The village is almost free of traffic as it is by_passed by the main Wells to Shepton Mallet road unlike the less fortunate villages of Dinder and Croscombe. The{piped water still comes from a private supply on Maesbury. Modern trends are, however, to be seen in the reduction in local shops and services.
